part.name: P1
part.heading: Application for Grant of Permit or Issue of Licence

section.name: s2
section.heading: Submission of plans and information
section.leadIn: An application for the grant of a permit or for the issue of a licence shall be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: 3 copies of a plan showing, to the satisfaction of the licensing authority, the layout of the premises to which the application relates and showing the use of each part thereof and in particular, the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: each part of the premises intended to be used for karaoke;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each part of the premises intended to be used as a lounge, a dining area, a dancing area, a reception area, a kitchen and food preparation area, an office, a store room or a staff room;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the location of all apparatus and equipment to be used for karaoke that are of a substantial and permanent nature; (L.N. 241 of 2002)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the exit routes;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the location of all sanitary fitments and their drainage connections;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the location of all fire service installations and equipment;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the means of ventilation of the premises including the location of all windows, ducts and any mechanical means of supplying ventilation; and

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: the location of all furniture and fixtures of a substantial and permanent nature; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such information as may be required by the licensing authority for assessing the adequacy of the means of escape and the sanitary fitments provided.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Suitability of premises for operation of karaoke establishment

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether premises to which an application relates are suitable for the operation of a karaoke establishment under section 5(3)(b)(i) of the Ordinance, the licensing authority may take into account whether or not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fire service requirements set out in Schedule 1 are complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the premises are structurally suitable for the operation of the karaoke establishment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there are adequate means of escape from the premises and adequate means of access for firefighting and rescue in case of emergency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the premises are adequately protected by fire resisting construction;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: sanitary fitments to a standard not less than that required by the provisions of the Building (Standards of Sanitary Fitments, Plumbing, Drainage Works and Latrines) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. I) applicable to restaurants are provided; (E.R. 4 of 2020)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: where building works as defined in section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) have been commenced or carried out on the premises, approval and consent have been obtained from the Director of Buildings under section 14 of that Ordinance, and where such building works have been completed, the certificate required to be given to the Director of Buildings under regulation 25 of the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A) has been received by the Director; and (E.R. 4 of 2020)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: where a fixed electrical installation as defined in section 2 of the Electricity Ordinance (Cap. 406) is installed in the premises—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case where the installation is not yet required to have been certified under regulation 20 of the Electricity (Wiring) Regulations (Cap. 406 sub. leg. E), a copy of the work completion certificate issued in respect of the installation for the purposes of regulation 19 of those Regulations has been submitted to him; or (E.R. 4 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, a copy of the latest periodic test certificate issued in respect of the installation for the purposes of regulation 20 of those Regulations has been submitted to him.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), premises shall be regarded as structurally suitable for the operation of a karaoke establishment if the requirement set out in section 1 of Schedule 2 is complied with.

For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), premises shall be regarded as having adequate means of escape and adequate means of access for firefighting and rescue in case of emergency if the requirements set out or referred to in sections 2, 3 and 4 of Schedule 2 are complied with.

For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), premises shall be regarded as adequately protected by fire resisting construction if the requirements set out or referred to in sections 5, 6 and 7 of Schedule 2 are complied with.

Where a permit or a licence is granted or issued in respect of any premises, the licensing authority shall certify the plan of the premises submitted under section 2 to the effect that the permit or licence is granted or issued on the basis of the layout as shown on the plan.
The licensing authority shall give one copy of the certified plan to the grantee or licensee and retain 2 copies of the certified plan.

A grantee or a licensee who wishes to alter or add to the layout of the premises as shown in the certified plan shall apply in writing to the licensing authority for approval in such manner as the licensing authority may specify.

The licensing authority shall approve an alteration or addition to the layout of any premises if he is satisfied that the premises will remain suitable for the operation of the karaoke establishment after the proposed alteration or addition.

Where the licensing authority approves any alteration or addition to the layout of any premises, he shall endorse his approval on the certified plan of the premises or certify a new layout plan thereof in replacement of the existing certified plan, and subsection (2) shall apply accordingly.

part.name: P2
part.heading: General Conditions Applicable to Karaoke Establishments in respect of which Permits or Licences have been Granted or Issued

section.name: s5
section.heading: General maintenance
section.content: Each part of the premises to which a permit or a licence relates and all seating, fittings and apparatus in the premises, including electrical, cooling, ventilating and other installations, shall be properly maintained such that the safety of persons using the premises will not be adversely affected.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Sanitizing facilities for microphones
section.content: Adequate sanitizing facilities for all microphones shall be provided and maintained in the premises to which a permit or a licence relates and the microphones shall be kept in a clean and hygienic condition.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Alterations to layout
section.content: Except with the prior approval in writing of the licensing authority, no alteration or addition shall be made to the layout of the premises as shown in the plan certified by the licensing authority under section 4.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Display of permit or licence
section.content: The permit or licence shall be displayed in a conspicuous position near the entrance of the karaoke establishment in respect of which the permit or licence is granted or issued.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 5 or 7 is contravened; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 6 or 8 is contravened,

subsection.continued: the grantee or licensee commits an offence and in the case where the grantee or licensee is a body corporate or a partnership, the person whose name appears on the permit or the licence as the representative of the body corporate or partnership also commits an offence. (L.N. 241 of 2002)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person charged with an offence under subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a representative of a body corporate or a partnership whose name appears on the permit or the licence concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a grantee or a licensee who is an individual,

subsection.continued: it shall be a defence for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he did not know and had no reason to suspect the existence of the circumstances giving rise to the contravention; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: he could not, by the exercise of reasonable supervision and reasonable diligence, have prevented those circumstances arising. (L.N. 241 of 2002)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1)(a) is liable— (L.N. 241 of 2002)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on first conviction, to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a second or subsequent conviction, to a fine at level 6 and imprisonment for 1 year,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence, to a further daily fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1)(b) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on first conviction, to a fine at level 3 and imprisonment for 3 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a second or subsequent conviction, to a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence, to a further daily fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues. (L.N. 241 of 2002)

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Fire Service Requirements for Karaoke Establishment

section.name: s1
section.heading: Restrictions on location
section.leadIn: Karaoke establishments shall not be located—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on basement level 4 or below;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a building or any part of a building that is designed and constructed for industrial use; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any part of a building that is designed and constructed for commercial use if industrial use is permitted in any other part of the building and the part for commercial use is not completely separated from the part for industrial use by a buffer of non-fire-hazardous occupancy to the satisfaction of the Director of Fire Services.

subsection.content: All combustible materials used as false ceilings, partitions or wall furnishings shall conform to British Standard 476: Part 7 Class 1 or 2 Rate of Surface Spread of Flame or to another standard acceptable to the Director of Fire Services, or shall be brought up to any of those standards by treating with a fire retardant paint or solution acceptable to the Director of Fire Services.

All draperies and curtains, if installed, shall be made of fire resistant material and conform to British Standard 5867: Part 2 fabric type B when tested in accordance with British Standard 5438 or to another standard acceptable to the Director of Fire Services, or shall be brought up to any of those standards by treating with a fire retardant solution acceptable to the Director of Fire Services.

subsection.leadIn: All carpets within the protected means of escape shall—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: be made of pure wool;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: conform to British Standard 5287 when tested in accordance with British Standard 4790; or

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: be manufactured to a standard acceptable to the Director of Fire Services.

subsection.continued: Carpets that do not meet any of the above requirements shall also be accepted as complying with fire safety requirements if their pile height does not exceed 10 mm and they do not cover more than 5% of the protected means of escape calculated on a floor-by-floor basis.

subsection.content: All polyurethane foam filled mattresses shall conform to British Standard 7177 (for use in medium hazard premises) or to another standard acceptable to the Director of Fire Services.
All polyurethane foam filled upholstered furniture shall conform to British Standard 7176 (for use in medium hazard premises) or to another standard acceptable to the Director of Fire Services.

If more than 50% of the total surface area of the openable or breakable windows provided for the premises are rendered not openable or unbreakable, a smoke extraction system that conforms to the standard set out in the Code of Practice for Minimum Fire Service Installations and Equipment as published from time to time by the Director of Fire Services shall be provided.

All exits shall be indicated by illuminated signs, bearing the word and characters “EXIT 出口”, installed in accordance with the requirements set out in the Code of Practice for Minimum Fire Service Installations and Equipment as published from time to time by the Director of Fire Services. Adequate directional signs indicating the route to an exit shall be provided at locations where exit signs are not readily visible.
Low level directional signs capable of indicating the route to an exit in darkness shall be provided at 200 mm above floor level.

An exit plan drawn to a ratio of not less than 1:200 showing the floor layout of the premises and the directions of egress to escape staircases and means of escape shall be displayed in each room intended to be used by customers. The size of the exit plan shall not be less than 250 mm × 250 mm and shall be affixed adjacent to the exit of each room at 1 500 mm above floor level.
Emergency lighting shall be provided.
A short fire safety film shall be provided for showing to customers before they start the karaoke activity.

An emergency alert system which can interrupt the music or other sound and visual images produced by the karaoke equipment and at the same time produce visible and audible warning signals in case of a fire alarm shall be provided. (L.N. 241 of 2002)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fire service installations and equipment
section.leadIn: Fire service installations of the following description shall be provided in accordance with the following provisions and with the Code of Practice for Minimum Fire Service Installations and Equipment as published from time to time by the Director of Fire Services—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fire hydrant and hose reel system;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a manual fire alarm system with operation switches provided at each of the following locations—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: near each exit leading away from the premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the main entrance;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the cashier’s counter;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: at the reception area; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: at the waiting area;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: alarm bells of the fire alarm system in individual rooms intended to be used by customers;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the premises are located in a curtain-walled building or on a basement floor and occupy an area exceeding 126 m2, an automatic sprinkler system that uses fast-response-type sprinkler heads;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: where the premises are located in a place other than those described in paragraph (d) and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: occupy an area exceeding 126 m2 but not exceeding 230 m2, either an automatic fire detection system or an automatic sprinkler system; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: occupy an area exceeding 230 m2, an automatic sprinkler system that uses fast-response-type sprinkler heads;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: where the premises are located in a curtain-walled building or on a basement floor with a cubic volume exceeding 7 000 m3, a smoke extraction system.

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: in the case where the karaoke establishment is located in a restaurant, comply with the requirements set out in the Ventilation of Scheduled Premises Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. CE); or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: in any other case, comply with the requirements set out in the Building (Ventilating Systems) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. J).

subsection.content: Automatic cut-off devices shall be provided for mechanical ventilating systems to enable the ventilation supply to be cut off in case of fire.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Requirements regarding Structural Suitability, Means of Escape, Means of Access for Firefighting and Rescue and Fire Resisting Construction

section.name: s1
section.heading: Structural suitability
section.content: A karaoke establishment shall be structurally capable of withstanding an imposed load of not less than 5 kPa and be in sound structural condition.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Compliance with codes of practice concerning provision of means of escape, etc.

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: the Code of Practice for the Provision of Means of Escape in Case of Fire; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: the Code of Practice for Means of Access for Firefighting and Rescue,

subsection.continued: as published from time to time by the Director of Buildings shall be complied with.

subsection.content: The width of exit routes including internal corridors within a karaoke establishment shall be at least 1.2 m.

Every room intended to be used by customers, except toilets, in a karaoke establishment shall have at least 2 routes leading in different directions to a staircase or a point of discharge to a street except where the route leading to a staircase or a point of discharge to a street is possible only in one direction and this is unavoidable due to building design. In such a case, additional safety measures to the satisfaction of the licensing authority shall be provided.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Vision panels
section.content: Every room intended to be used by customers, except toilets, in a karaoke establishment shall have a vision panel that provides a clear view of things on the other side of the panel both from inside and outside the room. The vision panel shall be of a size not less than 0.04 m2 installed either on the wall facing the internal corridors or on the access door of the room.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Compliance with code of practice concerning fire resisting construction
section.content: The requirements set out in the Code of Practice for Fire Resisting Construction as published from time to time by the Director of Buildings shall be complied with.

subsection.content: Every internal corridor within a karaoke establishment shall be separated from other areas by a wall having a fire resistance period of not less than one hour (fire resisting wall) and the doors in the corridor shall be self-closing and have a fire resistance period of not less than 1/2 hour.

Every opening for the passage of air-conditioning ducts, ventilation ducts, electrical trunking, conduits, pipes and wires through a fire resisting wall and every hole in the wall left after construction shall be protected with fire dampers or other form of fire stop that is considered suitable by the licensing authority to maintain the required fire resistance period of the wall. If any such ducts, trunking, conduits, pipes, wires or insulation passing through the wall consist of combustible material, the material shall be contained within an enclosure having a fire resistance period of not less than one hour. Every access opening provided to the enclosure shall be provided with a door having a fire resistance period of not less than 1/2 hour.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Fire resistance period of vision panels
section.content: A vision panel required to be installed under section 4 shall have a fire resistance period of not less than that required for the wall or door on which it is installed.
